title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has inappropriate Class.forName() usage
description: The current issue in BidiUtil on win32 involves improper usage of Class.forName().
OB: The class lacks a private constructor, allowing unnecessary instantiation.
EB: A private constructor should be added to BidiUtil. Since there are no non-static methods in this class, adding a private constructor is a good practice. It prevents unnecessary instantiation and doesn't increase size, as the compiler provides a free public constructor.
SR: Replace the line above with: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); Testing is recommended to ensure it functions identically to the previous implementation.
